title: Any idea on why it's taking 15+ seconds to reconnect to the new client after a match?
body:
The general page didn't seem to have the solution, so I'm asking separately. It never was like this for the last few months. I can connect to games and champion select like usual, but whenever I finish a game, the client shows the L loading image for a good long while... I can even hear the chat box and people entering/leaving, but it takes about 20 seconds for it to show anything, and I always miss the after game chat :/

I've defragmented, used ccleaner to clear my junk files, upgraded my drivers, uninstalled a bunch of junkware, and even close unnecessary programs in my system tray and task manager. Is there a setting that I need to change or is it just the client being buggy? I would say it could be my CPU but it's worked before and with other things.

Any help would be appreciated :3

replies.body:
It sounds like this is happening in the Beta Client. Do you also experience this in the Legacy Client? You can access it from the login screen:

https://i.imgur.com/drrzBd9.png

Let me know what you find.
Thank you for the reply, the old client is so ugly now though ;-; I think I'll sacrifice load times for aesthetic lol

I have this issue as well, I use an older computer and it seems to be around 30-35 seconds for the client to load after the game closes. I can confirm that it only has this problem on the beta client for me.

Since you're on older hardware, have you tried enabling *low spec mode* and disabling *Animation* inside the client? This can improve performance in various areas of the client. You can access the settings from the cog icon in the top-right corner of the client:

http://image.prntscr.com/image/598e949fe2904c85b3220875cf13760f.png

Let me know if this helped.
Yes, this happens WITH low spec mode on and animations off. It is much worse otherwise.
